results.title: My grandfather, the spy
results.brief_description: It was wartime when Edwina’s grandfather met her grandmother. He had a toothache and met his wife to be at the front door. Her father was the local dentist. Edwina tells her grandfather’s extraordinary life story.

results.title: Life: What a Ride
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”
results.description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. results.title: Not worth worrying about
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” I found a mass at the top of my breast. My doctor assured me it was nothing to worry about, I trusted his opinion.”

results.title: Wild at Heart
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “They say tragedy comes in threes, my mum’s cancer, my brother’s accident and now me.”

results.title: Isolated but not Alone
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.I love living in the bush, I especially love rearing my kids in a rural area. It’s something about the sense of freedom, space and community. But distance can be hard when you have a serious illness.

results.title: Living not dying
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “For the past six years, I have been living with, not dying from, advanced breast cancer. My original diagnosis was in 1996, when I was 40 years old.”
results.description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “For the past six years, I have been living with, not dying from, advanced breast cancer. My original diagnosis was in 1996, when I was 40 years old.”

results.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “I said to the doctor, I don’t care if I die tomorrow but I don’t want to leave my daughter alone. He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”
results.title_for_label: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey

results.title: In the Mind's Eye
results.creator_credit: Emma Buckland, David Blake and Jess Chapkoun
results.brief_description:
The final outcome from a work experience project with Swinburne Unversity of Technology (TAFE) Multimedia Course, Computing and IT Department. “How do you communicate? Do you really listen? Do you respond to what’s been said or do you just talk about your own memory and experience? Dive into “The minds
eye”, a small film that explores what it will take for us to pay attention and react. Directed Written and Produced by Jess Chapkoun, Emma Buckland and David Blake.
Music by Susan Ellis & Stuart Porter and Ivan Rosa & Matthew Farrington
